abstract.text: A description of a list of triangle primitives, as motion keyframe data, to turn into an acceleration structure.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A base class for descriptors that contain geometry data to convert into a ray-tracing acceleration structure.
A description of a list of bounding boxes, as motion keyframe data, to turn into an acceleration structure.
A description of a list of triangle primitives, as motion keyframe data, to turn into an acceleration structure.
Creates a new triangle descriptor.
A buffer that contains indices for the vertices that compose the triangle list.
The offset, in bytes, to the first index in the buffer.
The data type of indices in the index buffer.
The number of triangles in the buffers.
An array of motion keyframes, each containing triangle data.
The stride, in bytes, between vertices in each vertex buffer.
Geometry data for a specific keyframe to use in a moving object.
Simplify data access and improve GPU utilization by storing custom primitive data directly in the acceleration structure.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Improving Ray-Tracing Data Access Using Per-Primitive Data

abstract.text: A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

value.title: Creating a Triangle Motion Geometry Descriptor
